item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H7063-7065)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H2478-2479, H2480-2483)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Fortuno, Luis G. [R-PR-At Large]

item.name: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text:
Alternative Pluripotent Stem Cell Therapies Enhancement Act of 2007 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop techniques for the isolation, derivation, production, or testing of stem cells that are capable of producing all or almost all of the cell types of the developing body and may result in improved understanding of treatments for diseases and other adverse health conditions, but are not derived from a human embryo.

Requires the Secretary to: (1) provide guidance concerning the next steps required for additional research; (2) prioritize research with the greatest potential for near-term clinical benefit; and (3) take into account techniques outlined by the President's Council on Bioethics and any other appropriate techniques and research.

bill.title: Alternative Pluripotent Stem Cell Therapies Enhancement Act of 2007

item.title: Alternative Pluripotent Stem Cell Therapies Enhancement Act of 2007
Alternative Pluripotent Stem Cell Therapies Enhancement Act of 2007
To derive human pluripotent stem cell lines using techniques that do not harm human embryos.

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H7063-7065)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
